js.user
Class JsCSSStyleSheet

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Var<JsObject>
          js.core.JsObject
              js.dom.DOM2CSS.CSSStyleSheet.Prototype
                  js.user.JsCSSStyleSheet
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObjectLike
public class JsCSSStyleSheet
extends DOM2CSS.CSSStyleSheet.Prototype

An opaque class representing JavaScript client-side objects of the global JsClient.CSSStyleSheet class.

This class represents a CSS stylesheet. It has properties and methods for disabling the stylesheet, and for querying, inserting, and removing style rules. IE implements a slightly different API than the DOM standard. In IE, use the rules array instead of cssRules, and use addRule(String, String, int) and removeRule(int) instead of the DOM standard insertRule(String, long) and deleteRule(long).

The JsCSSStyleSheet objects that apply to a document are members of the JsDocument.styleSheets array of the JsDocument object. The DOM standard also requires that any <style> or <link> element or JsProcessingInstruction node that defines or links to a stylesheet should make the JsCSSStyleSheet object available through a sheet property, but this is not widely implemented.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects. The checkcast operation to the class literal of this interface must be ignored and instanceof to it always true.

Field Detail

cssRules

public static final JsArray.Member cssRules

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCSSStyleSheet object refers to a read-only array holding the JsCSSRule objects that compose the stylesheet. In DOM-compliant implementations, this array includes objects that represent all rules in a stylesheet, including at-rules such as @import directives.

In Internet Explorer, use the rules property instead.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
rules
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

disabled

public static final Value.Boolean.Member disabled

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCSSStyleSheet object refers to a boolean value. If it is true, the stylesheet is disabled and is not applied to the document. If false, the stylesheet is enabled and is applied to the document.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

href

public static final Value.String.Member href

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCSSStyleSheet object is a read-only reference to the URL of a stylesheet that is linked to the document or null for inline style-sheets.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

parentStyleSheet

public static final JsCSSStyleSheet.Member parentStyleSheet

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCSSStyleSheet object is a read-only reference to the stylesheet that includes this one or null if this stylesheet was included directly in the document.

Since:
1.0

Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

public static final JsArray.Member rules

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The IE equivalent of cssRules that is DOM-standard.

1.0

title

public static final Value.String.Member title

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCSSStyleSheet object is a read-only reference to the title of the stylesheet, if specified. A title may be specified by the title attribute of a <style> or <link> element that refers to this stylesheet.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

type

public static final Value.String.Member type

An opaque static field defining a member that is named by the field name without a qualifying member and to access the property of the name on an object.

The property, identified by this member, of a JsCSSStyleSheet object is a read-only reference to the type of this stylesheet, as a MIME type. CSS style-sheets have a type of "text/css".

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must resolve the member of this static field to the identifier of the field name.

addRule

public final void addRule(java.lang.String selector,
                          java.lang.String style,
                          int index)

IE-specific method to add a CSS rule to a stylesheet.

This method inserts (or appends) a new CSS style rule at the specified index of the rules array of this stylesheet. This is an IE-specific alternative to the standard insertRule(String, long) method. Note that the arguments to this method are different from those to insertRule(String, long).

Parameters:
selector - The CSS selector for the rule.
style - The styles to be applied to elements that match the selector. This style string is a semicolon-delimited list of attribute:value pairs. It does NOT begin and end with curly braces.
index - The position in the rules array at which the rule is to be inserted or appended. If this optional argument is undefined, the new rule is appended to the array of rules.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
insertRule(String, long)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

deleteRule

public final void deleteRule(long index)

DOM-standard method to delete the rule at the specified position.

This is a DOM-standard method that deletes the rule at the specified index from the cssRules array. See removeRule(int) for an IE-specific alternative.

Parameters:
index - The index within the cssRules array of the rule to be deleted.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.INDEX_SIZE_ERR if index is negative or greater than or equal to the length of the cssRules array, or the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if this stylesheet is read-only. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
removeRule(int)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

insertRule

public final java.lang.Number insertRule(java.lang.String rule,
                                         long index)

DOM-standard method to insert a new rule into the stylesheet.

This is a DOM-standard method which inserts (or appends) a new CSS rule at the specified index of the cssRules array of this stylesheet. See addRule(String, String, int) for an IE-specific alternative.

Parameters:
rule - The complete and parseable text representation of the rule to be added to the stylesheet. For style rules, it includes both the element selector and the style information.
index - The position in the cssRules array at which the rule is to be inserted or appended.
Returns:
The value of the index argument.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - JavaScript throws a JsDOMException object with the JsDOMException.code property of the value JsDOMException.NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR if the stylesheet is read-only, the value JsDOMException.INDEX_SIZE_ERR if index is negative or greater then the length of the cssRules array, the value JsDOMException.HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR if CSS syntax does not allow the specified rule at the specified location, or the value JsDOMException.SYNTAX_ERR if the specified rule text contains a syntax error. See Js.err(Object) for JS Simulation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
addRule(String, String, int)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.

removeRule

public final void removeRule(int index)

IE-specific method to delete a rule.

This method removes the CSS style rule at the specified index of the rules array of this stylesheet. This is an IE-specific alternative to the DOM-standard deleteRule(long) method.

Parameters:
index - The index in the rules array of the rule to be removed. If this optional argument is undefined, the first rule in the array is removed.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
deleteRule(long)
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must convert the instance invocation of this method directly into a JavaScript invocation on its current object instance without changing the method name, but expanding variable arguments, if any, into comma-separated values.
